recipe.title: How to Make Soba
recipe.intro: Soba are thin Japanese noodles made from buckwheat. You can eat them hot or cold.
recipe.ingredients: dried soba noodles, water, soy sauce, mirin, dashi stock, green onion, wasabi, nori (seaweed)
steps: **Boil** a lot of water in a big pot.
**Cook** the soba noodles in the water for four or five minutes.
**Drain** the noodles and wash them in cold water.
**Mix** soy sauce, mirin, and dashi stock in a small pot and heat it.
**Put** the cold soba on a plate and cut green onion on top.
**Serve** with dipping sauce, wasabi, and nori on the side. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Teneriffe Sunset Terrace last Friday evening. It was by the Brisbane River. The terrace was very big and I could see the river and the sunset. The sky turned pink and purple. I ordered cold soba with dipping sauce. The noodles were smooth and the sauce was delicious. There were small yellow flowers on every table. The music was soft and the feeling was very cozy. I really liked this place.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Can you show me how to make soba?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Sure! First, we boil a lot of water.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: OK. How long do we cook the noodles?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Then we drain them and wash them in cold water.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: It makes the noodles smooth and firm.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I see. What about the sauce?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: We mix soy sauce, mirin, and dashi together.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Do we serve it hot or cold?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Today we will serve it cold. It is very good on a hot day.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Great! I will try making it now.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Good luck! Call me if you need help.
